etymology.description: Triplication of 口, representing various objects. Also occurs in 區.
etymology.interpretation: Three mouths or containers arranged together conveys a collection of items, leading to senses like goods and products. The tripled form also suggests abundance and categorization, extending to meanings such as many and grade when evaluating items.

examples.chinese: 商店里的商品很多(商店裡的商品很多)，价格公道(價格公道)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngdiàn lǐ de shāngpǐn hěn duō, jiàgé gōngdào.
examples.english: The store has many goods, and the prices are fair.

examples.chinese: 他懂得品茶(他懂得品茶)，分得出上品和下品(分得出上品和下品)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dǒngdé pǐn chá, fēn dé chū shàngpǐn hé xiàpǐn.
examples.english: He knows how to appreciate tea and can distinguish top grade from low grade.

examples.chinese: 这家厂的产品分为三等品(這家廠的產品分為三等品)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā chǎng de chǎnpǐn fēn wéi sān děngpǐn.
examples.english: This factory’s products are divided into three grades.
